title: SmartGold01
author: SmartGold01
content: Yes just as the title says, we need the world to come our aids we just have few hours to our General presidential elections in Nigeria and we don't want those old fools to rule is again. We need a young president who will be there for everyone irrespective of Gender, religion and Ethnicity.We need Peter Obi as our next president!Election day is on Saturday.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: I believe this is more appropriate if you will move this topic on Nigeria local board since this about your local politics and the user living on Nigeria is your only target because they are the one who can vote for president stated on your OP. I support you on your advocacy if it means that the new president will change the current rotten system on your current government admin.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: I understand that having a fair, transparent and democratic election process is essential in any country. And, of course, we all hope that Nigerians elect a leader who cares about the country and its people. But, how do you expect the rest of the world to help out with that? No country should interfere in the democratic processes of another country when electing their leaders.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: SmartGold01 on February 23, 2023, 10:35:25 AMYes just as the title says, we need the world to come our aids we just have few hours to our General presidential elections in Nigeria and we don't want those old fools to rule is again. We need a young president who will be there for everyone irrespective of Gender, religion and Ethnicity.We need Peter Obi as our next president!Election day is on Saturday.I understand your desperation and frustration mate, but nobody from outside Nigerian will come to your aid. Every nation enjoys it's territorial integrity and sovereignty, which  means that no other country can directly decide on the outcome of the election. It is possible that some developed nations that has interest in the economy of Nigeria might want to manipulate the elections but the ball is in the court of Nigerians. They must decide who they want to govern them for the next four years. You must go out and cast your vote for your preferred candidate and ensure that your vote counts. Africa and the world is keenly observing the political developments in Nigeria because the country is a big player in the world's socio-economic space.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: The only time the rest of the world would step in to help Nigeria is if there was a war going on there or if something terrible happened to her. Other than that, the outside world cannot invade Nigerian territory and meddle with her election. Election observers can be sent from around the world during this time (the election period) to monitor how the election is progressing.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Today is the main day and I will want every Nigerian to go out and cast their vote to a visionary leader, a young and strong man not a man that is old enough to join their ancestors.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Stand your ground, the moment you ask for foreign help, is the moment you are doomed to be ruled by dictators for the rest of your life! No one is gonna help you other than yourself!

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: As long as there is no war in Nigeria, she don't need the world to come to her aid. Election is the only way in which citizens use to vote out bad government, therefore, I believe that Nigerians can see this election as an opportunity to vote in a good leader who cares about the people.Election is over in Nigeria but the collation of results is ongoing. There is a tricky act displayed by Independent National Electorate Commission (INEC) that is alarming. Before the election INEC promised that immediately the voters have casted their votes that the result will be sent to the database in Abuja but they didn't keep to their words. Up till now the results are still unable to reflect on the database. This kept me wondering that it is not Nigerians that cannot vote out bad leaders,neither is it the politicians that are rigging elections by vote buying but the body in charge of the exercise to make it a free and fair election is the problem of Nigeria.
